title: Transport in plants and animals: capture of nutrients in plants and animals
creator_credit: Shane Mulcahy, Glen Foster and Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education
brief_description: 1. “Transport in plants and animals”. Explains how plants and animals transport their nutritional requirements internally. Similarities and differences between the transport methods are discussed. 2. “Capture of nutrients in plants and animals”. Every living organism needs a method of taking nutrients and of spelling waste products. This program examines which nutrients are esential to plants and animals and compares the system used to achieve this exchange of substances.
